c74object.name: ears.paulstretch~
c74object.description: Implements the public domain 'Paulstretch' time stretching algorithm

inlet.description: Sets the stretch factor, either as a single number or as an llll containing an envelope in the form [[x factor slope] [x factor slope]...]. where x values' range depends on the envtimeunit attribute.

objarg.name: outnames
objarg.description: The outname attribute sets a name (or a wrapped list of names) for each of the buffer outles of the objects in ears. These names are only accounted for if the naming mode is 'Static'.

objarg.name: factor
objarg.description: Sets the stretch factor, either as a single number or as an llll containing an envelope in the form [[x factor slope] [x factor slope]...]. where x values' range depends on the envtimeunit attribute.

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Double-clicking on the object will open the display window for the output buffer(s). If more than 10 buffers are to be output, only the first 10 are displayed.

method.name: list/llll
method.description: A list or llll with buffer names will trigger the buffer processing and output the processed buffer names (depending on the naming attribute).

method.name: reset
method.description: If the naming attribute is set to 'Dynamic', the reset message will force the dynamic naming to cycle and restart from the first used name. This is especially useful in combination with iterative mechanisms.

method.name: write
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. An additional format message attribute specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writeaiff
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. An additional format message attribute specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writeflac
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. An additional format message attribute specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writeraw
method.digest: Save output as raw file with no header
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. An additional format message attribute specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writewave
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. An additional format message attribute specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

attribute.name: envtimeunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for time values inside envelopes: Milliseconds (default), Samples or Relative (0. to 1 as a percentage of the buffer length)

attribute.name: naming
attribute.description:
Chooses the output buffer naming policy:
0 (Copy): the buffer name is copied from the input (in-place modification). Notice that some objects do not allow this policy.
1 (Static): a single buffer (and hence buffer name) is created, and always used as output.
2 (Dynamic): a new buffer (and buffer name) is created for each new command. Beware! This may allocate a lot of memory! You can always cycle on a fixed set of names via the reset message.
You can use a shortcut to define the naming policy via a first symbolic argument: use = for copy, - for static and ! for dynamic.

attribute.name: outname
attribute.description: Sets the name for each one of the buffer outlets. Leave blank to auto-assign unique names.

attribute.name: spectral
attribute.description: If toggled, the algorithm works in the frequency domain, by overlap-adding FFT windows (default); if untoggled, it works in the time domain, by overlap-adding time grains

attribute.name: timeunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for time values: Milliseconds, Samples or Relative (0. to 1. as a percentage of the buffer length). Object usually default to Milliseconds, except for ears.repeat~ defaulting to relative.

attribute.name: winsize
attribute.description: Sets the windows size (the unit depends on the timeunit attribute)

c74object.discussion: The original algorithm is by Nasca Octavian PAUL, Targu Mures, Romania, http://www.paulnasca.com/

entry.name: Inlet 2 (float/list/llll)
entry.description: Stretch factor or envelope. Sets the stretch factor, either as a single number or as an llll containing an envelope in the form [[x factor slope] [x factor slope]...]. where x values' range depends on the envtimeunit attribute.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The original algorithm is by Nasca Octavian PAUL, Targu Mures, Romania, http://www.paulnasca.com/
